titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Daniel Katz - International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union Oral History Interviews OH.049

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-01-21 16:58:12 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

change.item: Revised by Weatherly Stephan to include additional access copies
Edited by Maddie DeLaere to add additional instances to existing archival objects with access copies
Edited by Linda Smith to add individual listings for original recording, preservation copy, access copy, and transcript for each interview subject in the inventory
Edited by Linda Smith to state that audiovisual recordings have been digitized and are accessible to patrons

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Daniel Katz - International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union Oral History Interviews

physdesc.extent: in 3 cassette boxes, 1 CD box, and 1 manuscript box.

did.abstract: Daniel Katz is a labor historian and educator, teaching at the Murphy Institute of the City University of New York. This collection dates from 1998 to 1999 and contains audio interviews conducted by Daniel Katz for his dissertation, A Union of Many Cultures: Yiddish Socialism and Interracial Organizing in the International Ladies' Garment Union, 1913-1941 (Rutgers University, 2003). Transcripts for some interviews are available.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.091.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Daniel Katz is a labor historian and educator, teaching at the Murphy Institute of the City University of New York. A former union organizer, he is a member of the Board of Directors of Jews for Racial and Economic Justice in New York City.

phystech.head: Audiovisual Access Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection dates from 1998 to 1999 and contains audio interviews conducted by Daniel Katz for his dissertation, A Union of Many Cultures: Yiddish Socialism and Interracial Organizing in the International Ladies' Garment Union, 1913-1941 (Rutgers University, 2003). Transcripts for some interviews are available.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Because of the assembled nature of this collection, copyright status varies across the collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation. Repository is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: In 2024, individual listings for original recording, preservation copy, transcript, and access copy were added to each interview subject in the inventory.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Duration: 64 minutes; Preservation Note: This audiocassette was incubated.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Duration: 64 minutes; Preservation Note: This is two recordings on top of one another, which makes it very difficult to understand what is being spoken.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Duration: 32 minutes; Preservation Note: Side 1 content is missing from recording.
